'''ZoneAlarm''' is a [[Firewall (networking)|software firewall]] originally developed by [[Zone Labs]], which was acquired in March 2004 by [[Check Point]]<ref>[http://www.checkpoint.com/press/2004/zlaquisition032904.html Check Point acquires Zone Labs] March 2004</ref>. It includes an inbound intrusion detection system, as well as the ability to control which programs can create outbound connections—the latter not available in the [[Windows XP]] Service Pack 2 firewall. {{As of|2009|alt=As of early 2009}}, the newest release is ZoneAlarm Internet Security Suite 2009. ZoneAlarm was formerly known as Zone Labs, the usage of which is declining.<ref>[http://www.zonealarm.com/store/content/company/aboutUs/pressroom/graphicResources.jsp?dc=34std&ctry=&lang=en Graphic Resources: ZoneAlarm by Check Point]</ref>
+
'''ZoneAlarm''' is a [[Firewall (networking)|software firewall]] originally developed by [[Zone Labs]], which was acquired in March 2004 by [[Check Point]]<ref>[http://www.checkpoint.com/press/2004/zlaquisition032904.html Check Point acquires Zone Labs] March 2004</ref>. It includes an inbound intrusion detection system, as well as the ability to control which programs can create outbound connections—the latter not available in the [[Windows XP]] Service Pack 2 firewall. {{As of|2009|alt=As of August 2009}}, the newest release is ZoneAlarm Extreme Security 2010. ZoneAlarm was formerly known as Zone Labs, the usage of which is declining.<ref>[http://www.zonealarm.com/store/content/company/aboutUs/pressroom/graphicResources.jsp?dc=34std&ctry=&lang=en Graphic Resources: ZoneAlarm by Check Point]</ref>
